alert.note: Alert for Carlton; Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 16 at 3:46PM CST until December 16 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN PINE AND WESTERN CARLTON COUNTIES... At 345 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Askov, to near Willow River, to near Kettle River, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility of one quarter of a mile or less in heavy snow. This includes Interstate 35 from near Barnum, to Moose Lake to Sandstone. Roads may quickly become snow covered. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous travel. Locations impacted include... Sandstone, Mahtowa, Barnum, Willow River, Askov, Cromwell, Rutledge, Kettle River, Bruno, Fond Du Lac Band Sawyer Area, Sturgeon Lake, Finlayson, Denham, Grindstone Lake Pine County, Moose Lake State Park, Sawyer, Banning State Park, Kettle Lake, and Friesland. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution, slow down and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Do not use cruise control in winter driving conditions.
